item.title: Astrid add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Wilkie Collins
item.description: "The books - the generous friends who met me without suspicion - the merciful masters who never used me ill!" -- Wilkie Collins

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?" -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Astrid add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "What you fear most of all is —fear. Very wise..." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "Walking the stacks in a library, dragging your fingers across the spines -- it's hard not to feel the presence of sleeping spirits." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "Ghosts don't haunt us. That's not how it works. They're present among us because we won't let go of them." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Anderson Cooper
item.description: "The farther you go...the harder it is to return. The world has many edges and it's easy to fall off." -- Anderson Cooper

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "I read a book one day and my whole life was changed." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Margaret Walker
item.description: "When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book." -- Margaret Walker

item.title: Astrid add a quote by David Hockney
item.description: "I think I’m greedy, but I’m not greedy for money - I think that can be a burden - I’m greedy for an exciting life." -- David Hockney

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Tony Kushner
item.description: "In this world, there is a kind of painful progress. Longing for what we've left behind, and dreaming ahead." -- Tony Kushner

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Astrid add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Danielle Steel
item.description: "Life, a good life, a great life is about "Why not?" May we never forget it." -- Danielle Steel

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Champagne, if you are seeking the truth, is better than a lie detector." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Mario Puzo
item.description: "I'll make him an offer he can't refuse." -- Mario Puzo

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "The past is always tense, the future perfect." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Astrid Lindgren
item.description: "Give the children love, more love and still more love – and the common sense will come by itself." -- Astrid Lindgren
